Text.Value: I don't have time to celebrate just yet.
The road to Baldur's Gate. Choked with monsters - or it was.
As I was scouting, I found signs of someone clearing them out.
I had business out in the wilds, and no one else was doing anything.
This new god has a tight grip on Moonrise Towers, and it was a dark place to begin with.
Go on. He'll want to speak to the one who saved his grove, I expect.
Godsdammit, Zevlor.
I take it this business of yours won't keep you with us?
I find a clear path to the city, you keep everyone alive long enough to use it. That was the plan.
Came back to report some lunatic had cleared out the goblin leaders - only to find Zevlor'd gone the same way.

EditorData.NodeContext: Amused at the irony, but really just covering sadness with grim pragmatism

Text.Value: I do. We'll have to part ways here.
My people will join your camp tonight - a farewell, if you'll have us.
No bloody heroics... But I guess heroics were necessary to survive all of this. Who are you?
No point spreading honey on dung - he's dead. Godsdammit, Zevlor.
The saviour Zevlor mentioned in his last message. Well met.
Great big druid strolled in, too. Halsin - reckon he'll want a word with you. Once he's done with Kagha, anyway. When you're free...

EditorData.NodeContext: Grimly amused - she wouldn't want to be in Kagha's shoes as Halsin's going to take her to task for the harm she caused at the grove. The 'when you're done' leads to her mentioning she and her followers will join your camp to celebrate.

Text.Value: Trust a priest not to say it plain - he's dead, then. Gods damn it, Zevlor.
The saviour Asharak mentioned in his last message. Well met.
I'd love to stay, but I have more to do out here.
Right. Just let me know when you're ready.
Great big druid strolled in, too. Halsin - reckon he'll want a word with you. When you're done...

EditorData.NodeContext: Just recalling. The 'when you're done' leads to her suggesting the tieflings join your camp for a celebration

Text.Value: Dead. He fell defending the grove.
Don't fancy being in Kagha's shoes right now. Reckon he'll be happier to speak to you, though.

EditorData.NodeContext: Grimly amused at the reckoning that awaits Kagha when Halsin finds her. Brightening at the thought of how happy Halsin will be to see you

Text.Value: Never mind that. Where were you while we fought for our lives?
Being judged by Kelemvor as we speak. I hope he's not found wanting.
Let's do it.
Rotting with the rest of the corpses, I expect.
Beshaba's black bones, I'm too late. You - where's Zevlor?

EditorData.logicalname: Attack on Den - Zevlor was Leader

Text.Value: Great. Let's go now.
Find us when you're done. We'll join your camp and drink to fallen foes tonight - if you'll have us.
Right. Lead the way.
But if what Zevlor said of you is true... you have unfinished business out here.
Fair enough - I can see you've bled for us, so I won't prod any further.
Here. It's faint thanks compared to what you've done for us, but it's all we have.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Cerys(S_DEN_BackupLeader)] (Construction ANIM) give object out of frame <SimonG>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: She hands you something off-screen. Not defined.
EditorData.NodeContext: She hands you something off-screen. Not defined.

Text.Value: I found a path to the city - and with those goblins dead, there'll never be a better time to get on it.
I prefer not to travel with civilians.
We've another road to walk, and it's past time we were on it. Though... I suppose some thanks is in order.
Good to go?
As do I. But you've done your part, so I suppose it's time I did mine.
One thing - take care to the west. This new god has a tight grip on Moonrise Towers.
That's my business.
I lost track of him in the battle.
Trust a priest not to say it plain - he's dead, then. Godsdammit, Asharak.
Ah - there you are. No, we haven't met - but I know your work.

EditorData.NodeContext: Wry, distant - she wants to speak with you but also resents you a little (Though she knows it's unfair)

Text.Value: But if what Asharak said of you is true... you have unfinished business out here.
Should you be heading west, be careful.
He was supposed to play chaperone with this lot, not me. But - moaning won't make the road ahead shorter, I suppose.

EditorData.NodeContext: Wry, vaguely bitter - as if Zevlor shirked left her with a task she'd rather not have to do.

Text.Value: Beshaba's black bones, I'm too late. You - where's Asharak?
I prefer to keep my affairs to myself, thanks.
Here. It's faint thanks compared to what you've done for us, but it's all we have.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Cerys(S_DEN_BackupLeader)] (Construction ANIM) give object out of frame <SimonG>
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: She hands you something off-screen. Not defined.
EditorData.NodeContext: She hands you something off-screen. Not defined.

Text.Value: Introduce yourself.
Gods above - that's the druid. Some timing you have, Halsin.
No point spreading honey on dung - he's dead. Godsdammit, Asharak.
That was me.
Godsdammit, Asharak.

Synopsis: Cerys is a tiefling ranger who has been out scouting the road ahead for Zevlor/Asharak, trying to find a way through the goblins on the road. She returns just after the attack on the den to discover her leader is dead, and that she'll have to take his place. She seeks player out immediately and forces a dialogue..
